channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot hole been “fixed” but rattling man hole cover has not been sorted. Extremely loud, 3rd March
item.description:
Evesham rd just past the grange, almost in line with the dog bin
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and broken pavement Christchurch Road, 3rd March
item.description:
On the right hand side of pavement of Christchurch road when facing Christ Churchbetween Well Place and Malvern Road. This is a very busy pavement and is extremely dangerous as can be seen via the photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole on Hucclecote lane, uphill, towards churchdown., 3rd March
item.description:
Deep pothole / moon crater (!) on Hucclecote lane, uphill, towards churchdown. Difficult to locate on the map, I think it's past the line of houses, towards the Honey Bee barn (on the right).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mulch/ mud on pavement, 3rd March
item.description:
The steps down from the honeybourne way onto the path beside river Chelt is mostly covered in mulch and mud. Makes use of the path and steps dangerous and messy. I've reported this in December and been given a work request number ( which I can no longer find). But the path hasn't been cleared. Many thanks Martin Jones.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne Way, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Traffic light timing appears to have changed since the resurfacing works have been carried out. The lights are only green for a short period of time for Hucclecote Road travelling towards Brockworth causing long traffic queues down Hucclecote Road., 3rd March
item.description:
Traffic lights at the Hucclecote Road, Churchdown Lane, Carisbrooke Road junctions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Deepening pothole outside 54 Colesbourne Road, 3rd March
item.description:
There is a pothole by the side of an existing 'patch' that is progressively worsening. Unfortunately, it is shedding stones from the sub-surface and these are now being flicked onto cars and property by passing vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Colesbourne Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

In the middle of the roadway outside number 26.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain blocked causing road to flood, 3rd March
item.description:
Location: Harp Hill just uphill of the junction with greenway lane There are two drains, one either side of the road. The one on the reservoir side appears to be blocked causing the road to flood making it impassable for pedestrians and dangerous fit cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire road, from Swindon Road down to the junction with Elmfield Avenue, is in an appalling state and has been for, 3rd March
item.description:
All of Elmfield Road! Can we have proper resurfacing, please? It's a busy road, so the cost would be justified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Elmfield Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of smashed/damaged paving stones, 2nd March
item.description:
The paving stones are situated immediately outside the front of the Queens Hotel at the Montpellier end of the Prom. I suspect that vehicles/coaches are parking half-on/off the double yellow lines which I believe is illegal. There is no other obvious reason as to why so many paving stones are cracked and wobbling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Imperial Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
